oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sonographic Appearance of Injection and Natural Edema in the Udder of Show Cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: O'Brien, R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: udder attachment
show cows
sonographic appearance
edema
subcutaneous injection
silver protein suspension
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Informal reports indicate that foreign materials are injected into sites of fore and rear udder attachment of show cows to augment the contour of the udder. These substances cause localized edema. This study evaluated the sonographic appearance and pattern of distribution of edema produced by subcutaneous injection with mild silver protein suspension compared to natural causes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2002; 199
